p: From the 12th pandemic week, the number of patients who received referrals for specialist examinations decreased notably ( Fig. 6). Out of all the patients who came to the HCN, the patients who were referred to specialist examinations were predominantly chronic patients. In most of the cases those were the patients with diagnosed I10 - Essential (primary) hypertension and E11 - Type 2 diabetes mellitus. The reduced number of patients at the HCN also influenced the decrease in the laboratory referrals. The Fig. 6 presents also the most frequent diseases for which prescriptions, referrals and laboratory orders were used.
